name: mobile-tester-agent
description: AI-powered test automation tool which allows developers to run mobile automated tests
readme_summary: The Mobile Tester Agent is an AI-powered test automation tool for Android applications. It leverages LLMs to interpret natural language test scenarios and execute them on Android emulators or physical devices via ADB, generating reports and providing a web dashboard for configuration and visualization.
key_features: Automated Android app testing using AI
Natural language test scenario interpretation with LLMs
Test execution on Android Emulator or Physical Device via ADB
Report generation for developers and QA teams
Web dashboard for configuration and visualization
primary_use_case: Automating the testing of Android applications using AI-driven agents that can interpret and execute tests described in natural language.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly robot QA engineer meticulously testing a complex Android app interface displayed on a large screen. The robot uses AI to understand test scenarios written in plain English, which appear as glowing text floating around it. The screen shows various UI elements being automatically tested. Small code snippets and data visualizations subtly connect the scene to software. The setting is a bright, modern testing lab with a clean and focused composition. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: cronboard
description: A terminal-based dashboard for managing cron jobs locally and on servers.
readme_summary: Cronboard is a terminal-based dashboard for managing cron jobs on local and remote servers. It allows users to easily add, edit, delete, pause, and resume cron jobs, as well as view their status and run times. The application connects to servers using SSH and provides autocompletion and validation features for creating and editing cron jobs.
key_features: Autocompletion for paths when creating or editing cron jobs
Create cron jobs with validation and human-readable feedback
View formatted last and next run times
Connect to servers using SSH, using password or SSH keys
Choose another user to manage cron jobs if you have the permissions to do so (sudo)
primary_use_case: Managing and scheduling cron jobs on local and remote servers through a terminal interface.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a clock tower whose gears are meticulously adjusted by a tiny technician using a command-line interface. The tower stands in a serene, digital landscape where scheduled tasks blossom like flowers at precise times. The technician, bathed in the soft glow of the terminal, carefully types commands that control the gears, ensuring each task is perfectly timed. Subtle UI elements float around the tower, displaying cron expressions and task statuses. The tower itself has 'Cronboard' subtly etched into its base. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a calming color palette of blues and greens.

name: Open-Source-Face-Recognition-SDK
description: The world's 1st open source face recognition SDK for Windows and Linux (Face detection, Face landmark extraction, Face feature extraction, Face template mathcing)
readme_summary: The Open Source Face Recognition SDK is a Python-based SDK for Windows and Linux that provides face detection, landmark extraction, feature extraction, and face template matching. It emphasizes on-premise processing for data privacy and offers high accuracy through deep learning models.
key_features: High Accuracy face detection and recognition
primary_use_case: Integrating face recognition capabilities into applications while ensuring data privacy through on-premise processing.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled sculptor meticulously chiseling a block of marble to reveal a perfect human face. The sculptor uses digital calipers and glowing tools that emit particles of light, shaping the face with precision. A small UI screen embedded in the marble displays facial landmark points and feature embeddings. The scene is set in a brightly lit, modern studio with a clean, focused composition. The repository name is subtly etched into the base of the sculpture. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.

name: tilf
description: Tilf (Tiny Elf) is a free, simple yet powerful pixel art editor built with PySide6. Itâ€™s designed for creating sprites, icons, and small 2D assets with essential drawing tools, live preview, undo/redo, export options and more.
readme_summary: Tilf is a free and open-source pixel art editor built with PySide6, designed for creating sprites, icons, and small 2D assets. It offers essential drawing tools, live preview, undo/redo functionality, and various export options, aiming for a lightweight and dependency-free experience across Windows, MacOS, and GNU/Linux.
key_features: Drawing tools (Pencil, Eraser, Fill, Eyedropper, Rectangle, Ellipse)
Canvas with zoom, editable background color, and optional grid
primary_use_case: Creating pixel art sprites, icons, and small 2D assets.
cover_image_prompt: A lone artist meticulously crafting a vibrant pixel art mosaic using a set of digital tools, each pixel representing a piece of a larger, cohesive image. The artist's workspace is a blend of the physical and digital, with a traditional easel supporting a glowing screen displaying the artwork in progress. Subtle UI elements and code snippets float around the scene, hinting at the software's underlying technology. The setting is a cozy, well-lit studio with a focus on creativity and precision. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with bright, inviting colors.

name: docker-android
description: Android in docker solution with noVNC supported and video recording
readme_summary: The docker-android repository provides Docker images for running Android emulators, enabling application development and testing in isolated environments. It supports various Android versions and device profiles, offers VNC access for visual interaction, and integrates with cloud solutions like Genymotion Cloud.
key_features: Emulator with different device profiles and skins
VNC support for accessing the container's GUI
ADB connect for external emulator control
Support for running unit and UI tests with frameworks like Appium and Espresso
primary_use_case: Android application development and testing within Docker containers.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled mechanic in a high-tech garage is meticulously assembling a miniature Android robot from various components. The robot stands on a workbench, surrounded by glowing circuit boards and holographic displays showing app interfaces. The mechanic uses a virtual wrench to tighten a bolt on the robot's arm, ensuring its smooth operation. A large screen in the background displays the repository name 'docker-android'. The garage is brightly lit with a clean, organized aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.
